titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Henry Clay at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Indiana University Libraries.

change.item: Edits and rearrangement of content into requisite Lilly EAD structure, including addition of abstract, bioghist, scopecontent, controlaccess, relatedmaterial, and c01 levels of container list. Madison Chartier.

did.abstract: The Clay mss., 1812-1849, consists of a collection of political letters of congressman, U.S. senator, and secretary of state Henry Clay , 1777-1852.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Henry Clay, 1777-1852, was a congressman, U.S. senator, and secretary of state.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The contents of this collection are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Clay mss., 1812-1849, consists of a collection of political letters of Henry Clay, 1777-1852, congressman, U.S. senator, and secretary of state.

Included is also a collection, 1841-1859, of printed notices of meetings, circulars, etc. (most of which are also printed) of various New York City Clay organizations, including the Central Clay Committee, the Democratic Clay Club of the 10th ward, the Young Men's Henry Clay Association, and the Clay Festival Association.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Clay mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
